entry.title: Seongsu Bridge collapsed (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after the Seongsu Bridge collapsed (pictured) in Seoul, radiographic testing found that 110 of the 111 connections in the bridge were filled with defects?

entry.title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Suzhou (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Roman Catholic Diocese of Suzhou has both the tallest Catholic church building in China and the first ever Chinese bishop to meet the pope?

entry.title: Christine Joblin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that French astrochemist Christine Joblin co-created a webcomic to popularize her research on the origins of cosmic dust?

entry.title: The Pale Beyond (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the developers of The Pale Beyond were inspired by stories from historical Antarctic and Arctic expeditions?

entry.title: Larry Kennedy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Larry Kennedy played professional baseball while serving as his town's mayor?

entry.title: BowieNet (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 1998, David Bowie launched BowieNet, a pioneering internet service provider which offered exclusive access to audio recordings, music videos, an online chat, and a virtual world?

entry.title: Sabine Marcelis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Dutch designer Sabine Marcelis was a semi-professional snowboarder in New Zealand before she decided to pursue a career in the arts?

entry.title: Paper House (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the walls of the Paper House are made from newspaper?
